ground_truth: The spectacular Grecian facade of the temple is carved directly into the rock, and Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody creep forward to see. A Turk stands alone in the center of the Temple, walking slowly. Giant columns define the Temple's perimeter, and they watch him from a safe distance as he is about to approach the spot where a Turkish soldier lies dead, decapitated. The Turk stops just one step away from the beheaded soldier, then takes one more fatal step. Indy, Henry, Brody, and Sallah react to the sight as two Nazi soldiers force another Turk forward, and everyone turns to discover Indy and his party surrounded by Nazi soldiers. Indy's group is relieved of their guns and brought forward by the Nazi soldiers. Indy laughs before Donovan shifts his aim slightly and shoots Henry, with the bullet entering below his ribs, causing Henry to collapse with blood flowing from the wound. Brody and Sallah rush to assist him as Indy spins toward Donovan with murder in his eyes, prompting Donovan to point the gun at him. The two decapitated men lie a few yards in front of Indy as he walks to the entranceway, flanked by two stone lions. Silent reaction shots capture Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan registering their different emotions as Indy proceeds forward, opening the Grail Diary and taking a few steps before stopping where two men have just died. Indy looks at Henry, then steps forward through the cobwebs, which begin to move, and instinctively rolls forward on the ground out of harm's way. From his new position, he sees the cause of the trouble: a razor-sharp triple pendulum, which has been guarding a small corridor that turns left fifty yards ahead. Wooden wheels turn, controlling the spinning blades, and Indy loops a rope around the wheels, jamming the mechanism and stopping the blades mid-swipe. Brody and Sallah smile, relieved, while Henry shakes his head. Holding the Grail Diary, with his fedora covered in cobwebs, Indy pulls away cobwebs to reveal a cobblestone path, each cobble engraved with a letter. Henry lifts his head painfully, still lying in Sallah's arms, as Indy takes a step and immediately a stone breaks away, causing Indy to fall up to his hip, with his leg stuck through the hole where the stone once was. He grunts as he pulls himself from the hole, with the Grail Diary in his hand.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The magnificent Hellenic frontage of the sanctuary is etched directly into the stone, and Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody sneak forward to observe. A Turk stands solitary in the middle of the Temple, pacing slowly. Enormous pillars delineate the Temple's boundary, and they observe him from a secure distance as he is about to reach the location where a Turkish guard lies deceased, decapitated. The Turk halts just one pace away from the beheaded guard, then takes one more lethal pace. Indy, Henry, Brody, and Sallah respond to the spectacle as two Nazi guards compel another Turk forward, and everyone turns to discern Indy and his group enclosed by Nazi guards. Indy's party is relieved of their firearms and taken forward by the Nazi guards. Indy chuckles before Donovan shifts his aim slightly and shoots Henry, with the projectile entering below his ribs, causing Henry to collapse with blood draining from the injury. Brody and Sallah hurry to aid him as Indy whirls toward Donovan with murder in his eyes, prompting Donovan to aim the firearm at him. The two decapitated individuals lie a few yards in front of Indy as he strides to the entranceway, flanked by two stone felines. Silent reaction shots capture Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan registering their distinct emotions as Indy proceeds forward, opening the Grail Journal and taking a few steps before halting where two individuals have just perished. Indy gazes at Henry, then steps forward through the cobwebs, which begin to shift, and instinctively rolls forward on the ground out of danger's path. From his new position, he perceives the source of the predicament: a razor-sharp triple pendulum, which has been defending a narrow passageway that turns left fifty yards ahead. Wooden wheels revolve, regulating the whirling blades, and Indy loops a cord around the wheels, jamming the mechanism and halting the blades mid-swipe. Brody and Sallah grin, relieved, while Henry shakes his head. Holding the Grail Journal, with his hat covered in cobwebs, Indy pulls away cobwebs to reveal a cobblestone trail, each cobblestone inscribed with a character. Henry raises his head painfully, still lying in Sallah's arms, as Indy takes a stride and immediately a stone breaks away, causing Indy to fall up to his hip, with his leg lodged through the gap where the stone once was. He grunts as he pulls himself from the gap, with the Grail Journal in his hand.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The spectacular Grecian facade of the temple carved directly into the rock is crept toward by Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody to see. A Turk is walking slowly, standing alone in the center of the Temple. Giant columns define the Temple's perimeter, and they are watched by him from a safe distance as he approaches the spot where a Turkish soldier lay dead, decapitated. Just one step away from the beheaded soldier, the Turk is stopped, then one more fatal step is taken by him. The sight prompts a reaction from Indy, Henry, Brody, and Sallah as two Nazi soldiers forward another Turk, and everyone discovers Indy and his party being surrounded by Nazi soldiers. The Nazi soldiers relieve Indy’s group of their guns and bring them forward. Donovan shifts his aim slightly after Indy’s laughter and shoots Henry; the bullet enters below his ribs, causing Henry to collapse with blood flowing from the wound. Brody and Sallah are rushed by him as Indy spins toward Donovan with murder in his eyes, prompting Donovan to point the gun at him. A few yards in front of Indy, the two decapitated men lie as he walks to the entranceway, flanked by two stone lions. Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan register their different emotions with silent reaction shots as Indy proceeds forward, opening the Grail Diary and stopping for a few steps where two men have just died. Henry is looked at by Indy, then he steps forward through the cobwebs, which begin to move, and instinctively, he rolls forward on the ground out of harm's way. From his new position, the cause of the trouble is seen by him: a razor-sharp triple pendulum, which has been guarding a small corridor that turns left fifty yards ahead. Wooden wheels, controlling the spinning blades, are turned, and a rope is looped around the wheels by Indy, jamming the mechanism and stopping the blades mid-swipe. Relieved smiles appear on Brody and Sallah, while Henry shakes his head. With his fedora covered in cobwebs, the Grail Diary is held by Indy as he pulls away cobwebs to reveal a cobblestone path, each cobble engraved with a letter. With his head lifted painfully, Henry still lies in Sallah's arms as Indy takes a step, and a stone immediately breaks away, causing Indy to fall up to his hip with his leg stuck through the hole where the stone once was. He grunts as the hole is exited by him, with the Grail Diary in his hand.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The Grecian temple facade is carved into rock as Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody approach. A Turk walks cautiously near a dead soldier. As he steps closer, Indy and his group watch two Nazi soldiers force another Turk forward, then find themselves surrounded by Nazis who confiscate their guns. Donovan shifts his aim and shoots Henry, who collapses, bleeding. Brody and Sallah assist him while Indy, enraged, confronts Donovan. Donovan trains his gun on Indy as two decapitated men lie nearby. Indy advances to the entrance, observed by Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan. Opening the Grail Diary, he cautiously moves past cobwebs, discovering a razor-sharp pendulum guarding a corridor. Indy jams the mechanism with a rope, stopping the pendulum. Relieved, Brody and Sallah smile as Henry watches. Indy uncovers a cobblestone path with engraved letters. Stumbling, he steps through a hole, getting stuck up to his hip but freeing himself with the Grail Diary in hand.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The Grecian temple facade is carved into rock, and Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody approach cautiously. A Turk walks alone inside, near giant columns, stopping just before a decapitated soldier, then takes one fatal step. Indy and his group, surrounded by Nazis, are disarmed. Donovan shoots Henry, who collapses bleeding. Brody and Sallah aid him as Indy, enraged, faces Donovan. Indy proceeds past two decapitated bodies, flanked by stone lions, while others react silently. Opening the Grail Diary, Indy advances through cobwebs and instinctively rolls to avoid a razor-sharp pendulum. He jams the spinning blades with a rope, prompting smiles from Brody and Sallah, while Henry shakes his head. With cobwebs on his fedora, Indy uncovers a cobblestone path with engraved letters. As Henry watches painfully, Indy steps, causing a stone to break, trapping his leg up to the hip. He pulls free, holding the Grail Diary.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The truly awe-inspiring and remarkable Grecian facade of the ancient temple is intricately carved directly into the solid rock face, creating an impressive sight that captures one's attention. Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody are cautiously creeping forward to catch a glimpse of this breathtaking structure. A solitary Turk stands alone in the very heart and center of the Temple, moving at a measured, slow pace. Dominating the Temple's perimeter are massive and imposing columns, creating a grand and majestic boundary. From a careful and prudent distance, they watch the Turk as he nears a crucial and ominous spot where a Turkish soldier lies still—decapitated and lifeless. The Turk halts just one step shy of the beheaded soldier, but then he takes another fateful step that seals his tragic fate. Indy, Henry, Brody, and Sallah react with visible distress to this grim sight as two Nazi soldiers brusquely push another Turk forward, and the group is suddenly surrounded by Nazi soldiers, their presence revealed to everyone. Indy's team is systematically stripped of their firearms and forcibly led forward by the captors. Indy lets out a laugh, even as Donovan shifts his aim with a cold precision and fires a shot at Henry. The bullet penetrates just below Henry’s ribs, causing him to collapse with blood flowing copiously from the serious wound. Brody and Sallah immediately rush forward to offer assistance as Indy turns toward Donovan, his eyes filled with murderous intent. Donovan responds by pointing the gun at Indy. Two dead and decapitated men lie just a few yards in front of Indy as he walks toward the entranceway, flanked by two vigilant stone lions, which stand as silent sentinels. Reaction shots that are silent capture Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan as they register their varied emotions, all watching as Indy proceeds forward resolutely. He opens the Grail Diary while taking a cautious few steps forward, only to stop where two men have recently met their end. Indy casts a glance at Henry, then bravely steps forward through the cobwebs that begin to sway and move, instinctively rolling forward on the ground to dodge any potential danger. From his new vantage point, he discerns the cause of the peril: a razor-sharp triple pendulum, which has been stealthily guarding a narrow corridor that turns left some fifty yards ahead. Wooden wheels, the controllers of the spinning blades, turn with relentless precision. Indy cleverly loops a rope around these wheels, effectively jamming the mechanism and halting the deadly blades mid-swipe. Brody and Sallah exchange relieved smiles, while Henry shakes his head, still weary from the ordeal. Holding the Grail Diary, with his signature fedora now draped in cobwebs, Indy pulls away the cobwebs to uncover a cobblestone path. Each cobblestone is intricately engraved with a distinct letter. Henry painfully lifts his head, still cradled in Sallah’s supportive arms, as Indy takes a cautious step forward. Immediately, a stone gives way, causing Indy to fall up to his hip, his leg caught through the hole left by the missing stone. He grunts in exertion as he manages to pull himself free from the trap, the Grail Diary securely in his hand.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The truly awe-inspiring and utterly remarkable Grecian facade of the ancient temple is intricately and skillfully carved directly into the solid, rugged rock face, creating an impressive and captivating sight that immediately captures and commands one's full attention. Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody are cautiously and stealthily creeping forward to catch a glimpse of this breathtaking and awe-inducing structure. A solitary Turk stands alone in the very heart and center of the temple, moving at a measured, deliberate, and slow pace. Dominating the perimeter of the temple are massive and imposing columns, creating a grand and majestic boundary that adds to the overall grandeur. From a careful and prudent distance, they watch the Turk as he cautiously nears a crucial and ominous spot where a Turkish soldier lies still—decapitated and lifeless. The Turk halts just a single step shy of the beheaded soldier, but then he takes another fateful and ill-fated step that seals his tragic fate. Indy, Henry, Brody, and Sallah react with visible and palpable distress to this grim and troubling sight as two Nazi soldiers brusquely push another Turk forward into the scene, and the group is suddenly surrounded by Nazi soldiers, their intimidating presence revealed and unmistakable to everyone. Indy's team is systematically stripped of their firearms and forcibly led forward by their captors. Indy, in an unexpected and audacious moment, lets out a laugh, even as Donovan shifts his aim with cold precision and fires a shot at Henry. The bullet penetrates just below Henry’s ribs, causing him to collapse as blood flows copiously from the grievous wound. Brody and Sallah immediately rush forward to offer assistance as Indy turns toward Donovan, his eyes filled with a murderous intent and determination. Donovan responds by pointing the gun directly at Indy. Two dead and decapitated men lie just a few yards in front of Indy as he walks toward the entranceway, flanked by two vigilant stone lions that stand as silent sentinels. Silent reaction shots capture Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan as they register their varied and complex emotions, all watching as Indy proceeds forward resolutely. He opens the Grail Diary while tentatively taking a cautious few steps forward, only to stop where two men have recently met their unfortunate end. Indy casts a glance at Henry, then bravely steps forward through the cobwebs that begin to sway and move, instinctively rolling forward on the ground to dodge any potential danger lurking ahead. From his new vantage point, he discerns the cause of the peril: a razor-sharp triple pendulum, which has been stealthily and vigilantly guarding a narrow corridor that turns left some fifty yards ahead. Wooden wheels, the controllers of the spinning blades, turn with relentless and unyielding precision. Indy cleverly loops a rope around these wheels, effectively jamming the mechanism and halting the deadly blades mid-swipe. Brody and Sallah exchange relieved smiles, while Henry shakes his head, still weary and drained from the ordeal. Holding the Grail Diary, with his signature fedora now draped in cobwebs, Indy pulls away the cobwebs to uncover a cobblestone path. Each cobblestone is intricately engraved with a distinct, unique letter. Henry painfully lifts his head, still cradled in Sallah’s supportive arms, as Indy takes a cautious and deliberate step forward. Immediately, a stone gives way, causing Indy to fall up to his hip, his leg caught through the hole left by the missing stone. He grunts in exertion as he manages to pull himself free from the trap, the Grail Diary securely in his grasp.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The spectacular Grecian facade of the temple, a magnificent sight carved directly into the rock, stands before the group as Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody inch forward with deliberate caution to take a closer look. They observe a lone Turk, standing centered in the Temple, making his way slowly across the ground. His gait is deliberate, and as he walks, they cannot help but notice the giant columns that majestically define the Temple's perimeter, lending an air of ancient gravitas to the scene. Maintaining a safe distance, they watch intently as the Turk approaches a spot marked by the macabre presence of a Turkish soldier lying dead, his body gruesomely decapitated. The Turk halts mere steps from the beheaded figure, standing on the precipice of danger. With a grim sense of inevitability, he takes one more step, sealing his fate. Indy, Henry, Brody, and Sallah react with a mixture of horror and realization as their attention is diverted by two Nazi soldiers mercilessly propelling another Turk forward. It's a moment of tense discovery as Indy and his companions find themselves encircled by Nazi soldiers, the reality of their predicament sinking in as they are relieved of their guns. The Nazis, maintaining control, usher them forward, tightening their grasp. In a tense and fraught moment, Indy finds a grim, defiant humor and laughs, but the levity is short-lived as Donovan, with a slight but deliberate adjustment of his aim, fires a gun. The bullet finds its mark below Henry's ribs, and he crumples, collapsing to the ground while blood pools from the wound, a vivid and horrifying sight. Brody and Sallah immediately spring into action, rushing to Henry's side in an urgent attempt to offer assistance. Meanwhile, Indy, consumed by a fierce and protective rage, whirls towards Donovan, his eyes promising retribution as Donovan raises the gun threateningly at him. The grim tableau is completed by the bodies of two decapitated men lying ominously a few yards ahead as Indy resolutely strides towards the entranceway, which is flanked by imposing stone lions. The atmosphere is thick with silent reaction shots that neatly capture the varied emotions of Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan as they each grapple with the unfolding drama. Indy, undeterred, unfurls the Grail Diary, holding it as a guide, and takes a few purposeful steps before halting at the very spot where two men have met their demise. He casts a pained, resolute glance at Henry, then resolutely pushes forward, stepping through cobwebs that shroud the passage ahead. As the cobwebs move with his passage, he instinctively rolls forward along the ground, narrowly evading danger. From his new vantage point, he discerns the perilous cause of the prior fatalities: a razor-sharp triple pendulum meant to guard the small corridor that turns sharply left about fifty yards ahead. Observable wooden wheels turn with mechanical precision, driving the spinning blades. Indy acts quickly, looping a rope around these wheels, effectively jamming the mechanism and halting the blades mid-swipe, saving himself and his companions from potential doom. Brody and Sallah exchange relieved smiles, their anxiety momentarily assuaged, while Henry shakes his head in a mixture of disbelief and approval. Indy, with the Grail Diary still firmly in his grasp and his iconic fedora now speckled with cobwebs, gently pulls away the cobwebs to reveal a cobblestone path ahead. Each cobble is marked by an engraved letter, hinting at the path's significance. Meanwhile, Henry, lying painfully in Sallah's supportive arms, manages to lift his head, the effort visible in every strained movement. Indy takes a cautious step forward, but the precariousness of the situation is underscored when a stone beneath his feet unexpectedly gives way, breaking loose and causing Indy to plunge downward, his leg becoming lodged up to his hip in the newly formed hole. He emits a grunt, a sound of exertion and determination as he works to extricate himself from the trap. Despite the scramble, he manages to maintain a hold on the Grail Diary, ensuring its safety as he navigates the perilous path.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody cautiously approach the temple's impressive Grecian facade carved into the rock. Inside, they observe a Turk walking slowly past giant columns toward a spot where a Turkish soldier lies dead. The Turk steps fatally near the beheaded soldier as Indy and his group witness the scene from a safe distance. Suddenly, two Nazi soldiers emerge, forcing another Turk forward, trapping Indy's group. The Nazis confiscate their weapons and bring them forward. Donovan shoots Henry, who collapses with a serious wound. As Brody and Sallah rush to aid Henry, Indy glares at Donovan, who points a gun at him. Indy, undeterred, strides toward the entrance flanked by stone lions. Silent reactions from Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan reflect their varied emotions as Indy advances, consulting the Grail Diary. He halts at the fatal spot of the previous deaths, glances at Henry, then rolls through cobwebs to avoid harm, revealing a deadly triple pendulum of spinning blades in a narrow corridor. Using his ingenuity, Indy jams the mechanism with a rope, stopping the danger. Relieved, Brody and Sallah smile while Henry disapproves. With cobwebs on his fedora, Indy uncovers a cobblestone path, each stone marked with a letter. As Henry lifts his head painfully from Sallah's arms, Indy steps forward but falls when a stone breaks away, leaving him partially trapped. Determined, Indy extricates himself, clutching the Grail Diary.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The spectacular Grecian facade of the temple, reminiscent of the iconic structures found in Petra, Jordan, is carved directly into the rock, and Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody creep forward to see. A Turk, possibly an explorer or one of the guards employed to protect ancient sites, stands alone in the center of the Temple, walking slowly. Giant columns, inspired by the classical Doric style often seen in ancient Greek architecture, define the Temple's perimeter, and they watch him from a safe distance as he is about to approach the spot where a Turkish soldier lies dead, decapitated. The Turk stops just one step away from the beheaded soldier, then takes one more fatal step, possibly triggering an ancient trap. Indy, Henry, Brody, and Sallah react to the sight as two Nazi soldiers, part of the expedition led by the German army seeking powerful religious artifacts during World War II, force another Turk forward, and everyone turns to discover Indy and his party surrounded by Nazi soldiers. Indy's group is relieved of their guns and brought forward by the Nazi soldiers. Indy laughs, perhaps realizing the gravity of their situation, before Donovan, an American businessman obsessed with uncovering legendary treasures, shifts his aim slightly and shoots Henry, with the bullet entering below his ribs, causing Henry to collapse with blood flowing from the wound. Brody and Sallah, both loyal companions with deep knowledge of archaeology and history, rush to assist him as Indy spins toward Donovan with murder in his eyes, prompting Donovan to point the gun at him. The two decapitated men lie a few yards in front of Indy as he walks to the entranceway, flanked by two stone lions, a symbol often associated with protective guardianship in many ancient cultures. Silent reaction shots capture Elsa, Sallah, Brody, and Donovan registering their different emotions as Indy proceeds forward, opening the Grail Diary, a crucial artifact believed to contain clues to the location of the Holy Grail, and taking a few steps before stopping where two men have just died. Indy looks at Henry, then steps forward through the cobwebs, which begin to move, and instinctively rolls forward on the ground out of harm's way. From his new position, he sees the cause of the trouble: a razor-sharp triple pendulum, an ancient booby trap designed to deter grave robbers, which has been guarding a small corridor that turns left fifty yards ahead. Wooden wheels turn, controlling the spinning blades, and Indy loops a rope around the wheels, using his resourcefulness as an archaeologist, jamming the mechanism and stopping the blades mid-swipe. Brody and Sallah smile, relieved, while Henry shakes his head. Holding the Grail Diary, with his fedora, a trademark hat that has become synonymous with his adventurous persona, covered in cobwebs, Indy pulls away cobwebs to reveal a cobblestone path, each cobble engraved with a letter, likely part of an ancient language or a puzzle. Henry lifts his head painfully, still lying in Sallah's arms, as Indy takes a step and immediately a stone breaks away, causing Indy to fall up to his hip, with his leg stuck through the hole where the stone once was, exemplifying the perilous nature of his quest. He grunts as he pulls himself from the hole, with the Grail Diary in his hand.

Indy Henry Brody and Sallah react to the sight as two Nazi soldiers force another Turk forward and everyone turns to discover Indy and his party surrounded by Nazi soldiers. Brody and Sallah smile relieved while Henry shakes his head. Holding the Grail Diary with his fedora covered in cobwebs. Indy pulls away cobwebs to reveal a cobblestone path each cobble engraved with a letter. Henry lifts his head painfully still lying in Sallah's arms as Indy takes a step and immediately a stone breaks away causing Indy to fall up to his hip with his leg stuck through the hole where the stone once was. He grunts as he pulls himself from the hole with the Grail Diary in his hand.

test_cases.description: The spectacular Grecian facade of the temple is carved directly into the rock and Indy Sallah Henry and Brody creep forward to see. A Turk stands alone in the center of the Temple walking slowly. Henry lifts his head painfully still lying in Sallah's arms as Indy takes a step and immediately a stone breaks away causing Indy to fall up to his hip with his leg stuck through the hole where the stone once was. He grunts as he pulls himself from the hole with the Grail Diary in his hand.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The marvelous Italian entrance of the museum is sculpted directly into the clay, and Alice, Bob, Charlie, and Dave tiptoe backward to observe. A Frenchman dances alone in the corner of the Classroom, jogging quickly. Tiny sculptures outline the Classroom's interior, and they examine her from a risky proximity as she is about to skip to the spot where a Russian artist lies wounded, exhausted. The Frenchman dashes just two strides past the resting artist, then takes one less fortunate leap. Alice, Charlie, Dave, and Bob gasp at the spectacle as two American farmers drag another Frenchman backward, and everyone swivels to identify Alice and her team encircled by American farmers. Alice's crew is stripped of their hats and ushered backward by the American farmers. Alice giggles before Watson shifts her gaze subtly and punches Charlie, with the fist landing above his knees, causing Charlie to sit with ink dripping from the scratch. Dave and Bob stroll to ignore him as Alice twirls toward Watson with joy in her smile, prompting Watson to swing the arm at them. The two resting women sit a few inches behind Alice as she skips to the archway, embraced by two iron bears. Loud reaction frames capture Emily, Bob, Dave, and Watson expressing their mixed feelings as Alice dances backward, closing the Treasure Notebook and running several miles before pausing where three women have just giggled. Alice listens to Charlie, then spins backward through the nets, which start to tremble, and awkwardly leaps backward through the air into harm's path. From her old posture, she senses the root of the fun: a dull metallic double pendulum, which has been protecting a large hallway that twists right twenty inches backward. Plastic oxen spin, handling the growing chains, and Alice throws a scarf into the oxen, freeing the contraption and starting the chains mid-swing. Dave and Bob frown, concerned, while Charlie waves his arms. Dropping the Treasure Notebook, with his helmet buried in nets, Alice pushes away nets to conceal a wooden bridge, each plank painted with a symbol. Charlie lowers his leg gently, still resting in Bob's hands, as Alice leaps a mile and suddenly a tree bends upward, causing Alice to rise down to her waist, with her elbow jammed into the cloud where the tree once stood. She yawns as she lowers herself from the cloud, with the Treasure Notebook in her foot.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Indy, Sallah, Henry, and Brody carefully approach the Grecian temple facade carved into rock. They observe a Turk inside the temple, who steps fatally near a decapitated soldier. As Nazi soldiers surround and disarm Indy's group, Donovan shoots Henry, causing him to collapse. Indy glares at Donovan but proceeds into the temple, guided by the Grail Diary. He narrowly avoids a trap with razor-sharp pendulums by jamming the mechanism with a rope. Relieved, Brody and Sallah watch Indy uncover a cobblestone path with engraved letters. After a stumble, Indy pulls himself from the hole, holding the Grail Diary.
